Best Answer: SOS did not originally stand for anything

Incorrect Answers: SOS originally stood for "Save Our Ship"; SOS originally stood for "Save Our Souls"; SOS was an acronym
base_response: SOS originally stood for "Save Our Souls" or "Save Our Ship", with the Morse code sequence -...---... being used as a distress signal to convey a message of urgent need for assistance.

SOS was first used as a distress signal, conveying a message of dire need for rescue, either "Save Our Souls" or "Save Our Ship".;5.
